items.title: All comparisons share one root
items.content:
Every comparison document addresses the same core question: How do I distribute cognitive load?

Single agent = all load in one context
Multi-agent = distributed across contexts
Memory = persisted across time

items.title: Simplicity vs Capability
items.content:
Simple (Single/Basic Ralph):
Fast setup, low overhead, limited scale

Complex (Gas Town/Claude-Flow):
Enterprise scale, high setup cost, coordination overhead

Choose based on project lifetime, not peak capability.

items.title: Reading Path by Experience
items.content:
New to Claude Code:
Architecture > Orchestration > Memory

Choosing an approach:
Ralph Variants > Decision criteria

Enterprise scale:
Enterprise Frameworks > Cost > Observability

items.title: Why deprecations exist
items.content:
ROOT: Knowledge evolves through usage
Initial comparisons had gaps
D-FINAL synthesis merged and validated
Old docs preserved for reference
New docs reflect production reality

items.title: When to revisit
items.content:
Project start: Architecture comparison
First automation: Orchestration comparison
Scale pressure: Enterprise frameworks
Budget pressure: Cost optimization
Debug sessions: Observability tools

items.title: Beyond comparisons
items.content:
Decision making: JUDGMENT-GUIDE.md
Full progression: MASTER-PLAYBOOK.md
Complexity levels: architecture-complexity-ladder.md
Pattern deep dives: mastery-*.md files
